channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: CDC data reveals 200,700 more people died than usual from March to July
item.description: An analysis of CDC data by The New York Times revealed that the United States recorded at least 200,700 more deaths from March to July this year than predicted - surpassing the death toll.

item.title: ABUL TAHER visits Jungle camp in Calais, saying you pay a fee and they'll keep putting you on a boat
item.description: The new Jungle camp in Calais, a scrubby field near the main hospital, is a kind of tented waiting room. So few made it to Britain from the infamous old encampment, which closed in 2016.

item.title: Police partially close Oxford Street after man is stabbed in broad daylight
item.description: Police and paramedics responded to the scene near to Market Place this afternoon. Police have confirmed that a teenager has died from his injuries and that three males have been arrested.

item.title: Harry's childhood friend 'had doubts' about Meghan, new book claims
item.description: According to the upcoming biography, Finding Freedom, Tom 'Skippy' Inskip had a falling out with Prince Harry after he shared his 'doubts' about the Duchess before they became engaged.

item.title: Husband, 90, dies of covid after visiting his dying wife who was stricken with the virus
item.description: Sam Reck, 90, passed away on August 1 at Florida's Lakeland Regional Health Medical Center - in the same room where his wife JoAnn died aged 86 on July 12.

item.title: What social distancing? 250,000 bikers begin descending on South Dakota for 10-day festival
item.description: Sturgis, South Dakota - population 7,000 - is welcoming 250,000 people this weekend for a motorbike rally. Mayor Carstensen said he was determined to encourage 'responsibility.'

item.title: Trump signs four executive orders on coronavirus aid after Congress negotiations stalled
item.description: Trump signed four executive orders related to what he called 'China virus relief' during a press conference at his golf resort in Bedminster, New Jersey, on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Is it ethical to infect volunteers with Covid-19 to test a vaccine?
item.description: Seán McPartlin, from Rathoath, Co Meath in the Irish Republic is one of 1,100 people under the age of 30 who have signed up to test the effectiveness of a coronavirus vaccine.

item.title: Drinkers pack into pubs and clubs after a day on beaches - but where's the social distancing?
item.description: Revellers were seen enjoying a drink after thousands crowded on beaches and gathered in parks with friends to soak up temperatures of 95F (35C).

item.title: Critics savage Shia LaBeouf's new gangland crime thriller The Tax Collector
item.description: Movie critics have called the new David Ayer written and directed movie, The Tax Collector, 'incompetent,' 'a bloody mess' and 'one of the most atrocious viewing experiences of the year.'

item.title: Finger of suspicion is pointed at the world's most expensive painting
item.description: Salvator Mundi sold for $450 million (£342 million) in 2017 but art expert Jacques Franck believes it is a 'workshop Leonardo' created by two of the artist's assistants.

item.title: Car drivers face £200million electric scooter crash bill
item.description: The Motor Insurers' Bureau (MIB) has paid out more than £100 million so far, but it estimates that bill will balloon to between £200 million and £2 billion a year.

item.title: New 'use by' dates on meat sold in supermarkets to provide shoppers 11 days to eat more beef
item.description: Chilled beef is currently given ten-day use-by labels. But in future, this timeframe is expected to be raised to 21 days in the fridge, with pork and lamb having 15-day and 14-day deadlines respectively.

item.title: Soccer pals' shock as teenager is accused of huge Twitter hack
item.description: Mason Sheppard, 19, could face up to 45 years in prison in America after prosecutors claimed that he played a key role in a plot to steal tens of thousands of pounds by hacking Twitter accounts.

item.title: Art critic 'solves' the riddle of Sir Edward Elgar's Enigma Variations
item.description: It is the musical puzzle that has seen Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star, the works of Shakespeare and even the mathematical formula for Pi suggested as possible answers.

item.title: TikTok will sue Trump over executive order banning Chinese app from US
item.description: TikTok is prepared to file a federal lawsuit against the Trump administration as early as Tuesday in the US District Court for the Southern District of California, a source revealed on Saturday.

item.title: Melbourne anti-masker protest slammed as Lord Mayor says it will breach COVID-19 safety
item.description: Only two people have turned up to a 'freedom rally' to protest coronavirus lockdown in Melbourne after 400 demonstrators showed interest in the illegal rally.

item.title: Who will stop the torturers of Beijing wiping Tibet from the face of the Earth?
item.description: NORMAN BAKER: At last the world is waking up to the horrors inflicted by the Chinese Communist party upon the people it has colonised. Recently, we have seen chained and blindfolded Uighurs.

item.title: Government urged to uphold Britain's world-leading agricultural standards after US trade deal fears
item.description: Save British Farming has unveiled new banners and posters urging the Government to 'save British food' by upholding our world-leading agricultural standards.

item.title: Exam chief defends marking system that could see 39% of pupils get lower marks than predicted
item.description: A-Level results will be published on Thursday, but this year's grades have been calculated using teachers' predictions combined with a statistical model due to the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Faith leaders across the world unite to condemn China's brutal repression of Uighur Muslim minority
item.description: Former Archbishop of Canterbury Rowan Williams is among a more than 40-strong group of religious leaders united to condemn China's brutal repression of its Uighur Muslim minority.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Churchill's grandson Nicholas Soames splits from his second wife
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: After 27 years of marriage, I'm sad to report that Sir Nicholas Soames and his wife Serena Smith are to divorce. The 72-year-old former Tory MP admitted they are living separately.

item.title: DAN HODGES: For new working-class voters, getting schools back is now as vital as Brexit
item.description: DAN HODGES:The nation expects its children to go back to school. And his fulfilment of that pledge is now even more vital than his pledge to get Brexit done.

item.title: Suspending Tory MP will 'lead to trial by innuendo', say friends
item.description: Friends of the Tory MP accused of raping a Commons researcher condemned opposition politicians last night for behaving 'like judge and jury' after demanding his suspension from the party.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protestors wave placards outside Tottenham police station
item.description: A crowd gathered in scorching temperatures to hear speeches and demonstrate outside Tottenham Police Station. Musician Wretch 32 could be seen mingling in the crowd.

item.title: Enjoy it while you can! Britain to bask in another day of soaring temperatures before flood warnings
item.description: Thunderstorms could batter the country from Tuesday with floods and hailstones expected as the Met Office warned homes and businesses could be damaged.

item.title: Two headed tortoise and museum mascot that turns 23 years old in three weeks is seen taking a bath
item.description: The two headed tortoise, called Janus, was born September 3, 1997 in the Museum of Natural History in Geneva, Switzerland on September 3rd 1997. New photos show the tortoise getting a bath and eating

item.title: WENDY HOLDEN: Has the Queen forgiven her governess who wrote the original Royal tell-all book?
item.description: WENDY HOLDEN: If The Little Princesses has any shocking revelations at all, it is the glimpse of something approaching obsessive compulsive disorder in Elizabeth.

item.title: Queen Letizia and King Felipe arrive in Mallorca with daughters Princess Lenor and Sofia
item.description: Queen Letizia, King Felipe VI of Spain and their daughters Princess Leonor and Princess Sofia were seen waving from a car as they arrived in Mallorca for their summer holidays on Saturday.

item.title: Business minister's sister was saved from the Beirut horror blast - by nipping to the loo
item.description: Moments earlier, Jihan Zahawi had been on the street outside her handicrafts shop just 500 yards from the warehouse where 2,750 tons of ammonium nitrate exploded.

item.title: Pianist plays Camptown Races for OAP singalong as charity show erupts into race row
item.description: Pianist Sarah Fisher was criticised for her 'inappropriate' choice of a song that dates from the era of 'blackface' minstrel shows and is famous of its 'doo-dah doo-dah' refrain.

item.title: One of Jeffrey Epstein's sex slaves claims a 'massage guru' introduced her to Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: Chauntae Davies was 21 and a trainee massage therapist when her 'mentor', Gypsy Gita, took her to the Four Seasons Hotel in Beverly Hills to give Ghislaine Maxwell a massage.

item.title: The hanging (basket) gardens of Bristol! Green-fingered Shaun nurtures a suburban wonder
item.description: Demolition worker Shaun Schroeder, 57, has transformed the modest garden of his semi-detached home in Bristol with more than 100 elegant hanging baskets and pots.

item.title: NHS paid more than 1.4billion for negligence last year almost double the amount paid five years ago
item.description: The £1.4billion figure is revealed in the annual report and accounts of NHS Resolution. NHS Resolution chairman Ian Dilks admitted the cost of clinical negligence is 'the eliphant in the room'.

item.title: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN'S NOTEBOOK: I'm all for girl power - but who's fighting for our boys?
item.description: For the vast majority of today's younger generation of men it must at times seem as if the playing field, rather than being levelled, is skewed in the opposite direction.

item.title: Expert: More transgender characters on TV is 'fuelling rise' in young people seeking help
item.description: Polly Carmichael, who is head of Britain's leading trans clinic for children, said programmes such as Butterfly helped 'normalise gender diversity'. Anna Friel and Callum are pictured above in Butterfly.

item.title: PROFESSOR TIM SPECTOR says everything you think you know about food is WRONG
item.description: PROFESSOR TIM SPECTOR: So much of what we swallow when it comes to advice about food is not backed up by science, while some of it can be categorically wrong.

item.title: Fire rips through block of flats in Bournemouth as flames are seen leaping from the collapsing roof
item.description: A fire has ripped across the roof of a block of flats in Bournemouth. It has reportedly been raging for more than five hours as firefighters continue to battle to get it under control.

item.title: Baby elephant falls into a river before a remarkable rescue effort takes place
item.description: First, an elder wrapped its trunk tightly around the baby's own, before a second elephant jumped in to push the stricken calf to safety at the Hapoor Dam near the Addo Elephant Park in South Africa.

item.title: Did we go into lockdown for no reason and are the mask rebels putting us at risk of a second wave?
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge has been leading the way by wearing a face covering while out in public to promote their use and potentially reduce the risk of a second wave.

item.title: Why Sweden, pilloried by the whole world for refusing to lock down, may be having the last laugh
item.description: IAN BIRRELL: As infections spike again in places that locked down, where schools struggle to reopen and the economic carnage grows clearer, is it possible Sweden made the right long-term call?

item.title: Ant McPartlin's ex Lisa Armstrong 'is dating someone new'... four months after her '£31m divorce'
item.description: The makeup artist, 43, is said to have met her new reported beau, James Green, before lockdown but started seeing him properly once restrictions started to ease.

item.title: Brooklyn Beckham's fiancée Nicola Peltz drops a hint couple may have married in secret
item.description: The American actress, 25, hinted that she and fiancé Brooklyn Beckham may have married in secret as she shared a snap of a gold ring on his finger to her Instagram stories on Friday.

item.title: Troops fire tear gas on Beirut protesters who hurl them back as streets brim with violence
item.description: Chaotic scenes returned to Beirut as clashes between anti-government protestors demanding regime change and security forces saw buildings damaged by Tuesday huge explosion set on fire.

item.title: In a crowded field, Jimi Hendrix was rock's number one Lothario, says a major new biography
item.description: Jimi's epic promiscuity may seem unendearing in the early 21st Century but in the 'permissive' Sixties it was considered quite normal - one of the more envied perks of the job.

item.title: Stop going on about my gold shoes and bright clothes, says the Tate's first female boss
item.description: Maria Balshaw, 50, says she is subjected to more scrutiny than male predecessors. Dr Balsahaw took over London's Tate galleries in 2017 and says she views her clothes as 'armour'.

item.title: Only half of Britons are 'very likely' to get a coronavirus vaccine
item.description: The damning figures come from a joint study by King's College London and Ipsos Mori, based on 2,237 interviews with UK residents aged 16-75.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell trawled galleries for 'gallerinas' to meet Jeffrey Epstein, claims former friend
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell regularly attended events at Christie's and Sotheby's to find so-called 'Gallerinas' to meet Jeffrey Epstein on both sides of the Atlantic, a former friend has claimed.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's secret girlfriend married a tycoon before 'disappearing' from New York scene
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's secret ex-girlfriend Shelley Anne Lewis tied the knot with wealthy Turkish property developer before Mahir Furtun five years ago, before 'disappearing' from the New York party scene.

item.title: Dr Alex George says he's 'holding on by a thread' as he hits out at troll after his brother's death
item.description: The former Love Island star, 29, took to Instagram on Saturday and said he is 'holding on by a thread' as he hit out a troll who criticised him for being on social media following the death of his brother Llyr.

item.title: UK could go back into lockdown next month, former government adviser warns
item.description: Sir David King urged the Prime Minister to 'get it right' on test and trace in August ahead of schools reopening - or face a second wave of coronavirus infections.

item.title: Conor McGregor announces engagement to long-term partner Dee Devlin in Instagram post
item.description: Irish former UFC champion Conor McGregor, who turned 32 last month, posted a picture with fiancé Dee Devlin on Instagram captioned: 'What a birthday, my future wife!'.

item.title: Emily woke up naked next to a stranger - after legal battle her tormentor has owned up to the truth
item.description: Emily Hunt's last recollection had been of enjoying a convivial lunch with her father five hours earlier. But then she had found herself, her head thumping, lying next to a man she didn't know.

item.title: Rishi Sunak's dishes will last until the autumn
item.description: Former Pizza Express chief executive David Page said sales at his 64 sites soared by up to 48 per cent last week - and revealed he is now planning to carry on offering discounts.

item.title: GILLIAN PHILIP tells how she was CANCELLED by her publisher after backing J.K. Rowling
item.description: GILLIAN PHILIP: What did surprise - and devastate - me was the cataclysmic fallout over the next 24 hours of posting the simple hashtag '#IStandWithJKRowling'.

item.title: Firefighters from four counties tackle Surrey wildfire as 100 residents from mansions are evacuated
item.description: Residents in 60 properties at Heather Drive, Surrey, home to around 100 people, were told to stay away for a second night as a wildfire on nearby Chobham Common continued to burn.

item.title: I'm A Celebrity 'will be filmed at a 200-year-old HAUNTED castle and include terrifying challenges
item.description: It appears that ITV have secured Gwrych Castle folly, near Abergele in Wales, at the cost of £1million for this year's season of the popular show.

item.title: Girl, 4, who miraculously survived Christchurch mosque massacre wants to face the shooter in court
item.description: Brenton Tarrant murdered 51 people and injured dozens more in a brutal massacre at the Al-Noor Mosque and Linwood Islamic Centre on March 15 2019.

item.title: Zsa Zsa Gabor's bizarre farewell tour of Europe nearly four years after her death
item.description: Zsa Zsa Gabor is going on a final 'farewell tour' - as her flamboyant widower plans to take her ashes on a trip around Europe before finally laying her to rest in her native Hungary.

item.title: Packed pubs are a bigger coronavirus risk than PLANES, experts warn
item.description: Dr Julian W Tang, professor of respiratory sciences at the University of Leicester, said the most common method of transmission in the UK is probably 'conversational exposure'.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Carrie Symonds are planning a stay in Scotland but they won't drop in on the Queen
item.description: The Prime Minister - who chose the Caribbean for his last pre-Covid holiday, at Christmas - will head north of the border with fiancee Carrie Symonds and baby son Wilfred later this month.

item.title: Kelly Osbourne stuns in taxi selfie showing off her transformative weight loss in fierce red onesie
item.description: Kelly Osbourne posted a photo to Instagram on Monday showing off her new svelte look in a red Gucci onesie, with her purple hair pulled back into a sleek braided bun.

item.title: Evgeny Lebedev accuses peerage critics of 'snobbery and casual racism'
item.description: Evgeny Lebedev was part of the latest peerages list including ex-MP Jo Johnson. Mr Lebedev, a friend of Boris Johnson, is the owner of the Evening Standard and Independent newspapers.

item.title: France demands £30million to help stem flow of migrants across the Channel
item.description: Britain's home secretary Priti Patel has teamed up with the defence secretary Ben Wallace to form a plan for tackling the migrant crisis in the UK.

item.title: Kate Moss and her daughter Lila, 17, share a tender holiday moment
item.description: Going back to work looks like the last thing on Kate Moss's mind as she enjoys a beach holiday with her teenage daughter Lila, 17. The one-time party girl shows that nowadays she's a model mum

item.title: Top Oxford vaccine scientists in ethics row over whether to infect volunteers with coronavirus
item.description: Professor Adrian Hill, director of the Jenner Institute at Oxford University, is setting up a human trial for one of the most promising drugs, but has been opposed by Professor Sarah Gilbert.

item.title: NASA ridiculed for dropping 'Eskimo Nebula' and 'Siamese Twins Galaxy' nicknames
item.description: NASA has been accused of bowing to 'woke culture' after it announced this week that it will no longer use the terms 'Eskimo Nebula' and 'Siamese Twins Galaxy' to describe celestial bodies.

item.title: Government warned about anger of voters over BBC's decision to scrap free TV licences for over-75s
item.description: The corporation says it was forced to limit free licences to those on pension credit from August 1 because it could no longer afford to waive the £157.50 annual fee for all over-75s.

item.title: Police record 172 vegan hate crimes in past five years
item.description: Last year, 1.16 per cent of the population, 600,000 people, were vegan according to surveys by Ipsos Mori. It quadrupled from 150,000 in 2014.

item.title: Plague kills second victim in China: Patient dies from multi-organ failure in remote Mongolian city
item.description: A second person has died of the plague in China's Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The victim died of multiple organ failure in a case of the bubonic plague on Friday in Bayannao'er.

item.title: Activist feted by Vogue at the heart of a paramilitary style black power protest group
item.description: Imarn Ayton, 29, has been ubiquitous during demonstrations in London following the death of George Floyd.

item.title: Can we have a photo? the children asked Amanda. 'Sure, I'll get Piers to take it...'
item.description: 'Could we have a photo?' the Dutch fans pleaded. 'Of course! I'll get Piers to take it. Do you know him?' The children peered at me with total uninterest. 'No. Who is he?'

item.title: Andrew Morton says Meghan Markle might be frustrated she hasn't been able to answer back to claims
item.description: Royal author Andrew Morton says in C5 documentary Harry and Meghan: The New revelations, which airs tonight, that Meghan was 'frustrated' she couldn't speak for herself.

item.title: DEBORAH ROSS: A sexy, mesmerising binge watch. But not with the kids
item.description: It's modern. It's fresh. It's sexy. It's visually stunning. It's superbly acted. It's daring. It's different. Enough to be getting on with?

item.title: Oxford Street 'will be boarded up in a year if nothing is done'
item.description: New figures show that the number of visitors to the West End - which includes Oxford Street, Regent Street and Bond Street -was down a scary 72 per cent last month compared with July 2019.

item.title: Jobless total is heading for 3m in worst slump since the 1980s
item.description: Key figures due on Tuesday are expected to show employment levels heading for depths unseen since the 1980s.

item.title: Boris Johnson says reopening schools next month is a 'moral duty' and a 'national priority'
item.description: In an exclusive article for The Mail on Sunday, the Prime Minister declares that a resumption of normal teaching is now his 'national priority'.

item.title: Huw Edwards weighed 16-and-a-half stone at heaviest amid depression battle following father's death
item.description: The BBC newsreader, 58, told how he began comfort eating following his father's death in 2010, eating to numb his emotional pain.

item.title: Missing out on school is disaster that lasts forever
item.description: Interrupted schooling has deep and long-lasting effects on children, according to Oxford University researchers who used data from school closures in a disaster zone.

item.title: No cases of school pupils passing on coronavirus to their teacher exist, expert says
item.description: All the available evidence points to children being poor spreaders of the virus, said Professor Mark Woolhouse.

item.title: No house guests, no church - but no face masks in the Queen's Balmoral Bubble
item.description: As Covid-19 continues to exert its grip on the nation, the Queen and her husband have retreated to their Scottish holiday home at Balmoral. But it is not business as usual - far from it.

item.title: Family warnings over psychotic killers 'ignored by NHS' as an author dies after shooting
item.description: James Nash, 42, a children's author, was shot in the head by Alex Sartain with a handmade gun outside his thatched cottage in Upper Enham, Hampshire on Wednesday. He died on Friday night.

item.title: HEALTH NOTES: Covid-proof clip makes cancer check-ups safe
item.description: Surgeons are using a specialised clip to trap coughs and sneezes - to make vital check-ups on patients with suspected cancer in the nose and throat 'Covid-proof'.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: It is time to give young people back their freedom
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON argues it is now time to grant young people greater Covid-19 freedom - even if it means people such as her - aged 43 - should face additional restrictions due to coronavirus.

item.title: EVE SIMMONS: Why putting calories on restaurant menus fills me with fear
item.description: Boris Johnson's personal health scare is partly behind the sudden push - in July, the Prime Minister blamed his severe Covid-19 illness, which put him into intensive care, on being 'too fat'.

item.title: Boy, six, is swept out to sea on an inflatable swan
item.description: Sam McKeeder, from Towyn, said the boy was about 200 metres off the shore when he found him off the swan and face-down in the water at Black Rock Sands in North Wales.

item.title: 'Murder-suicide' horror as woman in 30s is found dead before police find body of man
item.description: The woman, in her 30s, was pronounced dead at the scene at roughly 12.50pm today. And the body of a man was found two hours later on a road less than a mile away in Dagenham.

item.title: Great British boltholes: A review of Tickton Grange Country House Hotel, Yorkshire
item.description: The Mail on Sunday's Sarah Hartley checked into Tickton Grange, a country house hotel near Beverley. There are 20 acres of gardens to explore and the afternoon tea is a 'crowd-pleaser'.

item.title: Lap up the UK's finest hotel pools, from underground baths to wild clifftop ponds
item.description: Whether you're looking for somewhere to clock up the laps or the perfect spot to unwind, dive head first into our round-up of the UK's finest hotel pools.

item.title: London's calling if you want a perfect day out or a mini-break in the UK… with no crowds
item.description: Every week Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: why there's rarely been a better time to visit Britain's capital.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: Should the woman who said the IRA had a right to kill children really be a Baroness?
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: I invite those of you who still think Mr Johnson is a traditionalist patriotic conservative to ask yourself why he has put Ms Fox into Parliament.

item.title: Manhunt launched after 14-year-old girl is raped in broad daylight in Manchester
item.description: The schoolgirl, 14, was attacked on the canal tow path in the Northern Quarter of Manchester city centre last month. Police are searching for a man (pictured) in connection with the rape.

item.title: Body of a swimmer has been pulled from a water-filled quarry after he 'got into difficulty'
item.description: A man in his 20s drowned at Bawsey Pits near King's Lynn in Norfolk, police confirmed. Pictured, police at the scene earlier today.

item.title: Solar powered car attempts to break world record by driving 550 miles in 12 hours
item.description: The Nuna Phoenix, of the Vattenfall Solar Team, set off this morning at the National Road Traffic Agency test track in Lelystad, the Netherlands.

item.title: Cliff divers risk their lives jumping off rocks at Durdle Door despite recent life-changing injuries
item.description: Sunseekers climbed across the cliff before leaping into the water beneath them on the Dorset coast earlier today.

item.title: Shipwreck of 18th century floating gin palace bound for Tsarist Russia found in Gulf of Finland
item.description: An 18th century floating gin palace has been found in a shipwreck in the Gulf of Finland. Elaborate gin bottles found in the wreck appear to have a 'London' seal on them and were bound for Russian capital.

item.title: Man is stabbed following a car chase in 'rival taxing incident' in Manchester
item.description: Manchester detectives are investigating whether the stabbing was part of a 'taxing' between rival factions. One man was taken to hospital with serious but non-life threatening stab injuries.

item.title: The Queen leads well-wishers for Princess Beatrice as she turns 32
item.description: The Queen, 94, and Sarah Ferguson, 60, have sent Princess Beatrice their well wishes as she turns 32 today. They both took to Instagram to share adorable throwback photographs

item.title: BBC caught up in N-word row as 1Xtra presenter Sideman dramatically quits the broadcaster
item.description: BBC 1Xtra presenter Sideman, real name David Whitely has left the BBC today after it aired a report featuring a racial slur read by BBC social affairs correspondent Fiona Lamdin last month.

item.title: Britain records 16 more Covid hospital deaths - bringing toll to 34,027
item.description: The Government said 55 more people died in hospitals, care homes and the wider community in the UK since Friday, with another 758 confirmed coronavirus infections.

item.title: Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion stun with their XXX-rated 'WAP' video
item.description: Cardi B, 27, and Megan Thee Stallion, 25, released the racy video for WAP Friday. Yet many were unhappy with the cameo from Kylie Jenner, 22, who was accused of cultural appropriation.

item.title: Bear breaks into a parked pickup truck and makes off with a picnic basket in Colorado
item.description: Video footage from Colorado shows a plucky bear standing on its hind legs to open the door of a parked pick-up truck and swipe its lunch from a picnic basket.

item.title: Historic 'wine windows' used in Tuscany during plague come back into use during coronavirus
item.description: Restaurants and bars in Tuscany, Italy, have started reopening historic 'wine windows' as a creative measure to make sure customers socially distance.

item.title: Thousands of NHS nurses and healthcare staff march through UK streets in protest over pay
item.description: Anger is mounting as NHS workers were overlooked in the latest round of public sector pay rises which rewarded teachers and police - despite more than 500 NHS and social care staff dying from Covid-19.

item.title: Police hunt four men over graveyard murder of man, 34, at the church in locked-down Wigan
item.description: Stephen McMyler, 34, died outside Wigan Parish Church, in Bishopgate, Wigan, on Friday. Police, who were called around 7.50pm, believe there had been a 'earlier altercation' at the church.

item.title: Australian killed in Beirut horror blast is revealed to be two-year old little boy
item.description: Two-year-old boy Isaac Oehlers (pictured) has been identified as the Australian who was killed in the massive explosion which rocked Beirut on Tuesday.

item.title: Veteran who lost legs in Iraq becomes first above-the-knee double amputee to summit the Matterhorn
item.description: Neil Heritage, 39, along with friend Mark Hooks, 46, both from Poole, Dorset, successfully scaled the 14,692ft Alpine mountain on Friday.

item.title: Covid spikes in Benidorm and nearby Spanish town where cases have TRIPLED are linked to nightlife
item.description: A tourist resort near Benidorm is on the verge of lockdown as positive cases TREBLE in a week. The mayor of Vila Joiosa says young people are to blame for the rise in cases due to socialising.

item.title: Father runs over and kills 18-month-old boy in his 4x4 in freak accident
item.description: The 18-month-old boy died after being run over by his dad as he went to run errands after he reversed in his 4x4 from a rented holiday villa in Conil de la Frontera near Cadiz.

item.title: Boy, 13, is seriously injured after leaping more than 65ft into picturesque waterfall in Wales
item.description: The boy had jumped off the Sgwd Gwladys waterfall in Wales and suffered back and hip injuries when he hit the river bed. Rescuers had to winch him into a helicopter to be airlifted to hospital.

item.title: Man, 35, stabbed to death in knife fight as 200 revellers attend Jamaican Independence Day party
item.description: A man was stabbed to death and three others were injured in a knife brawl in Sheffield, South Yorkshire, as revellers attended a house party marking Jamaican Independence Day.

item.title: Mum discovers 'racist' T-shirt which features a black mermaid with 'too fluffy' hair in Tesco
item.description: Katie Wells, from Dover, Kent, has expressed her disgust after finding a T-shirt in the Whitfield brand of Tesco which described a black mermaid's hair as 'too fluffy.'

item.title: Air India survivor shares horrifying account after hilltop plane crash which left at least 18 dead
item.description: In a telephone interview from his hospital bed, Renjith Panangad, a plumber described making his escape by crawling through an emergency door. after the plane crash left them in darkness.

item.title: 'Don't kill granny': Preston youngsters are urged to stick to social-distancing
item.description: All residents in the city - home to 140,000 people - are now banned from mixing with any other households indoors or in a garden, in a last-ditch attempt to curb soaring rates of coronavirus.

item.title: 'Explosion' at Sussex port sends thick black smoke cloud that can be seen for miles into the sky
item.description: Huge plumes of smoke billowed from the industrial unit in Newhaven and nearby residents are being urged to keep doors and windows closed. There were no reports of injuries.

item.title: Mother-of-one reveals how spending £170 on IKEA items to declutter her home improved her wellbeing
item.description: Bex Kitchen, 25, from Peterborough, who has autism, anxiety and depression, told LatestDeals.co.uk how overhauling a room in her house has helped to boost her wellbeing.

item.title: The most Instagrammed home accessory trends of 2020
item.description: FEMAIL has revealed the most Instagrammed home accessory trends, based on research by MyJobQuote, including hoop art, cloud mirrors, French antiques, house plants and gallery walls.

item.title: Mechanic transforms a rusty old Volkswagen into a retro vehicle - which sold for $60,000 on Gumtree
item.description: An Australian mechanic with 24 years of experience has transformed a rundown retro van into a fully-functioning vehicle. After completing the project, the van sold for $60,000.

item.title: London landlord rents out garden shed for £1,500 a month
item.description: The three-bedroom 'designer' cabin in Muswell Hill is a sunlight trap with plenty of storage, a smart TV and Freeview, and an 'interesting layout'. The landlord wants it rented by the end of the month.

item.title: UK expects hottest day EVER; temperatures may hit 102F
item.description: The mercury is expected to hit at least 99F (37C) in the South East today, with a chance that last Friday's 100F (37.8C) recorded at London Heathrow - the UK's third-hottest day ever - could be broken.

item.title: UK Weather: Twitter users share funny memes in 99F heatwave
item.description: Furious Britons have taken to Twitter to share their outrage at the 'disgustingly hot' weather, as temperatures reached 97.5F (36.4C) today, making it the hottest August day since 2003.
